text: Thanks for the advice + refs! Out of curiosity, what do you guys typically use offhand? (Trying to choose among the many cool options :slightly_smiling_face: )

elements.text: Thanks for the advice + refs! Out of curiosity, what do you guys typically use offhand? (Trying to choose among the many cool options

text: When I was working on projects that would have benefited from these I didn't know about them! For what I'm working on at the moment I mostly use Turing.

elements.text: When I was working on projects that would have benefited from these I didn't know about them! For what I'm working on at the moment I mostly use Turing.

text: Unless I have a simple function of a few scalars, I avoid JuMP. And everytime I use a non commercial optimizer I get frustrated and use a commercial one.

elements.text: Unless I have a simple function of a few scalars, I avoid JuMP. And everytime I use a non commercial optimizer I get frustrated and use a commercial one.

text:
Knitro is a good nonlinear one and the vendors support for Julia and general responsiveness is good. Department licenses are cheap. . And it has all the bells and whistles for constraints, multistart, etc. But it isn't always the best.

Also Nlopt is solid for an open source one, and Optim is great for the stuff it is great at. But I am lazy and would rather not tune parameters much. Throw a multistart optimizer at it, get coffee, and trust the results

elements.text:
Knitro is a good nonlinear one and the vendors support for Julia and general responsiveness is good. Department licenses are cheap. . And it has all the bells and whistles for constraints, multistart, etc. But it isn't always the best.

text: Gotcha. I’ve basically only ever had luck w knitro and BlackBoxOptim (for not totally easy problems) but I am also a relative N00b

elements.text: Gotcha. I’ve basically only ever had luck w knitro and BlackBoxOptim (for not totally easy problems) but I am also a relative N00b

text: The benefit of the galacticoptim will be that you can easily switch between them. There isn't yet knitro support but it would be easy to add (and if you need it I may even have something half working)
